trailingComments.value:
*
 * [client] Define the physical setup in which the scenario takes place.
 *
 * The module contains information about the dimensions and outlines of the space, and optionally about the coordinates and labels of predefined positions (*e.g.* seats in a theater).
 *
 * The module retrieves the setup information from the server.
 * It never has a view.
 *
 * The module finishes its initialization when it receives the setup information from the server.
 *
 * **Note:** to render the setup graphically, see {@link Space}.
 *
 * (See also {@link src/server/Setup.js~Setup} on the server side.)

*
     * Type of the setup (values currently supported: `'matrix'`, `'surface'`).
     * @type {String}
     * @todo Remove?

leadingComments.value:
*
     * Type of the setup (values currently supported: `'matrix'`, `'surface'`).
     * @type {String}
     * @todo Remove?

*
   * Creates an instance of the class.
   * @param {Object} [options={}] Options.
   * @param {String} [options.name='setup'] Name of the module.

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Returns the number of positions in the setup.
   * @return {Number} Number of positions in the setup.

leadingComments.value:
*
   * Returns the number of positions in the setup.
   * @return {Number} Number of positions in the setup.

trailingComments.value: if (screenRatio > heightWidthRatio) { // TODO: refine sizes, with container, etc.
positionDiv.style.left = 0.5 * containerWidth - (0.5 * containerWidth - xOffset) * xFactor - size * 0.5 + "px";
positionDiv.style.top = 0.5 * containerHeight - (0.5 * containerHeight - yOffset) * yFactor - size * 0.5 + "px";
positionDiv.style.left = 0.5 * containerWidth - (0.5 * containerWidth - xOffset) * xFactor - size * 0.5 + "px";
positionDiv.style.top = 0.5 * containerHeight - (0.5 * containerHeight - yOffset) * yFactor - size * 0.5 + "px";

* The `addClassToPosition` method adds the class `className` to the position `index` in the `setupDisplay` DOM element (this graphical representation of the setup had to be created with the `display` method).

* The `removeClassFromPosition` method removes the class `className` from the position `index` in the `setupDisplay` DOM element (this graphical representation of the setup had to be created with the `display` method).

comments.value:
*
 * [client] Define the physical setup in which the scenario takes place.
 *
 * The module contains information about the dimensions and outlines of the space, and optionally about the coordinates and labels of predefined positions (*e.g.* seats in a theater).
 *
 * The module retrieves the setup information from the server.
 * It never has a view.
 *
 * The module finishes its initialization when it receives the setup information from the server.
 *
 * **Note:** to render the setup graphically, see {@link Space}.
 *
 * (See also {@link src/server/Setup.js~Setup} on the server side.)

*
   * Creates an instance of the class.
   * @param {Object} [options={}] Options.
   * @param {String} [options.name='setup'] Name of the module.

*
     * Type of the setup (values currently supported: `'matrix'`, `'surface'`).
     * @type {String}
     * @todo Remove?

*
   * Returns the number of positions in the setup.
   * @return {Number} Number of positions in the setup.
if (screenRatio > heightWidthRatio) { // TODO: refine sizes, with container, etc.
positionDiv.style.left = 0.5 * containerWidth - (0.5 * containerWidth - xOffset) * xFactor - size * 0.5 + "px";
positionDiv.style.top = 0.5 * containerHeight - (0.5 * containerHeight - yOffset) * yFactor - size * 0.5 + "px";
positionDiv.style.left = 0.5 * containerWidth - (0.5 * containerWidth - xOffset) * xFactor - size * 0.5 + "px";
positionDiv.style.top = 0.5 * containerHeight - (0.5 * containerHeight - yOffset) * yFactor - size * 0.5 + "px";

* The `addClassToPosition` method adds the class `className` to the position `index` in the `setupDisplay` DOM element (this graphical representation of the setup had to be created with the `display` method).

* The `removeClassFromPosition` method removes the class `className` from the position `index` in the `setupDisplay` DOM element (this graphical representation of the setup had to be created with the `display` method).
